block.p: Debt * First Data Corp., Hackensack, N.J., is selling $200 million of notes due in 2005 through Lehman Brothers. The notes are priced at 99.304 to yield 6.847 percent. The noncallable issue is rated A3 by Moody's Investors Service Inc. and A by the Standard & Poor's Corp.

Debt * First Data Corp., Hackensack, N.J., is selling $200 million of notes due in 2005 through Lehman Brothers. The notes are priced at 99.304 to yield 6.847 percent. The noncallable issue is rated A3 by Moody's Investors Service Inc. and A by the Standard & Poor's Corp.

* RJR Nabisco Inc., New York, is selling $650 million of notes in two parts through Merrill Lynch & Co. The first part consists of $400 million of notes due in 2001. The notes are priced at 99.795 to yield 8.043 percent. The second part is $250 million of notes due in 2007. The notes are priced at 99.490 to yield 8.819 percent. The noncallable issue is rated Baa3 by Moody's and BBB- by S.& P. and Duff & Phelps. Common * Komag Inc., Milpitas, Calif., filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell 1.75 million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co. will be the lead underwriter.
